div.l: And there they sette steuene for to mete
To pleyyn at the dyse in suche a strete
For in the toun was there no prentyse
That fayrer couthe caste a peyre of dyse
Than Perkyn coude and therto he was fre
Of hys dyspense in place of pryuete
That fond hys mayster wel in hys chaffare
For oftyme he fond hys box ful bare
For shortly aprentis that is a reuelour
That hauntith dyse Riot and paramour
His mayster shal it in hys shoppe abye
Al haue he no part of the mynstralsye
For thefte and riot they be conuertibyll
Al can he pleye on gyterne or Rybybyll
Reuel and trouthe as in a low degre
They be ful wroth alday as men may se
Thys Ioly prentis wyth hys mayster stood
Tyl he were neer oute of hys prentishod
Al were he snybbed bothe erly and late
And sumtyme led wyth Reuel to Newgate
But atte laste hys mayster hym bethoughte
Whon a day whan he hys paper soughte
Vp on a prouerbe that sayth thys same word
Wel bet is roten appyl oute of horde
Then that he roten al the remenaunt
So faryth it by a riotous seruaunt
It is ful lasse harm to lete hym pace
Than he shold al the seruauntis in the place
Therfore hys mayster yaf hym aquytaunce
And bad hym go with sorou and myschaunce
And thus thys Ioly prentis hadde hys leue
Now let hym riot al the nyght or leue
And ther is no theef withouten a lowke
That helpyth hym to waste and to sowke
Of that he brybe can or borow may
Anon he sente hys bed and hys aray
Onto a compyere of hys owen sorte
That louyth dyse riot and dysporte
